name: Darul Qasim
mission: TO FACILITATE THE LEARNING AND IMPARTING OF KNOKLEDGE DERIVED FROM PROPHETHOOD OF MUHAMMAD , ARABIC LANGUAGE AND RELIGIOUS EDUCATION
theoryOfChange: By providing rigorous academic training in the Prophetic inheritance (knowledge), the institution aims to produce scholars and professionals who can navigate modern challenges (like AI and ethics) through a sound Islamic epistemological framework.

evaluationSources: Illinois Board of Higher Education (IBHE) licensing evaluation

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.darulqasim.org/zakat (Source: https://www.darulqasim.org/zakat)

dimension_explanations.alignment: Darul Qasim shows medium alignment for Muslim donors by addressing global education needs and offering clear zakat-eligible giving options [3][7]. Its mission to integrate Arabic language and prophetic knowledge provides a specialized track record in Islamic epistemology [5][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through intensive academic programs like the Shaykh al-Hind curriculum [4][6]. While it maintains a healthy $3,290,091 in revenue and exceptional fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised, the program expense ratio stands at 51.9%, indicating that just over half of total expenses are directed toward primary programs [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Darul Qasim is an Islamic institution of higher learning dedicated to preserving and imparting traditional knowledge derived from the Prophethood of Muhammad.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with only $0.02 spent to raise every $1
Robust liquidity with 29.3 months of working capital available
Clear zakat eligibility and distribution policy for eligible students
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Glendale Heights, Illinois, Darul Qasim facilitates religious education through programs such as the Shaykh al-Hind Program and Intermediate Islamic Studies [1][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $3,290,091 and maintains a zakat-eligible status to support its educational mission [1][3].

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the curriculum effectively prepares students for religious leadership roles.

strengths.detail: The organization demonstrates high fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="2">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
Darul Qasim maintains <cite id="2">29.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term institutional growth.
The institution has a <cite id="6">25-year track record</cite> and a documented <cite id="4">theory of change</cite> centered on Islamic epistemology.

strengths_deep_dive: Darul Qasim's financial model is characterized by high sustainability and low overhead costs. Its <cite id="1">revenue grew from $2.15M in 2021 to $3.29M in 2023</cite>, showing strong donor confidence. The institution's governance is supported by an <cite id="2">independent board of 8 members</cite>, ensuring oversight of its <cite id="1">$10.2 million in total assets</cite>. Furthermore, the organization successfully diversifies its income through <cite id="1">$835,237 in program service revenue</cite>, indicating a healthy mix of tuition-based and philanthropic support.
rich_narrative.summary: Darul Qasim is a Glendale Heights-based institution of higher learning dedicated to the <cite id="4">preservation and distribution of traditional Islamic knowledge</cite>. Operating as a specialized college, the organization offers structured academic paths including the <cite id="4">Shaykh al-Hind Program</cite> and Advanced Islamic Studies, alongside specialized <cite id="5">Iftā and Takhaṣṣuṣ programs</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the institution reported <cite id="1">total revenue of $3,290,091</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 23.4%</cite>. The organization maintains a <cite id="3">verified zakat eligibility status</cite>, specifically utilizing these funds to support eligible students within its religious education framework. While the institution demonstrates <cite id="2">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only $0.02 to raise every $1, its <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 51.9%</cite> remains below the median for its peer group in the global education sector. Despite this, the organization maintains a <cite id="2">robust financial position</cite> with <cite id="2">29.3 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring long-term operational stability for its faculty and students.
